bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, October 7, 1952

div1.p: Hench secures a copy of Sternberg's "Report on the Etiology and Prevention of Yellow Fever," and will present it to Nogueira. He wants to know whether he will be invited to the dedication ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, October 7, 1952
div1.opener:
October 7, 1952
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219, Marianao
Havana, Cuba
My dear Pedro:
div1.p:
Fortunately I have secured a copy of Sternberg's
Report on the Etiology and Prevention of Yellow
Fever, 1890, which I want to present to you with
my compliments. However as these copies are
quite difficult to get and in view of the fact
that you have not yet received the book on Stern-
berg which I sent, I feel I should not mail it
to you, at least until the other turns up.

Will I be invited to the December 3 dedication?
If so, and if I could possibly come, I could bring
the book along at that time.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
P.S.: If the other book doesn't turn up, please
let me know as it was sent registered mail and
we can send a tracer
